author: Special Correspondent
text:
Collector visits villages and distributes voter awareness pamphlets

Collector S. Natarajan distributing voter awareness pamphlets to villagers fishing in a tank at Therku Mallal in Ramanathapuram district on Tuesday.

A day after introducing Systematic Voters’ Education and Electoral Participation (SVEEP) in fair price shops, District Election Officer and Collector S. Natarajan roped in Nehru Yuva Kendra for spreading voter awareness to achieve 100 per cent polling.

Mr. Natarajan, accompanied by Election Officer for Ramnathapuram Assembly constituency Rampradeepan, witnessed a play and cultural show organised by the Kendra near the new bus stand here on Tuesday.

The cultural troupe, through a stage, conveyed the message that every one who had completed 18 years of age on January 1, 2016, should enrol their names in the electoral roll and cast their votes in the May 16 elections.

They also staged a cultural show, highlighting the importance of voting in a democratic set-up, and called upon the people not to sell their votes for money.

Voting was the voice of their future and people should exercise their franchise properly, they also stressed.

Later, the Collector visited villages in Mudukulathur Assembly segment and distributed pamphlets to the people, urging them to discharge their democratic duty by casting their vote in the elections.

The Collector visited a kanmai (waterbody) at Therku Mallal, where the local people were engaged in fishing, and distributed voter awareness pamphlets to them.
title: Show throws light on importance of voting in democratic set-up
